Description: A rough wooden shabti-box of rectangular shape with a flat lid, formed of three boards. The ends are vaulted at the top and project below the base of the box. The surfaces are all plain with remains of plaster coating. The box contains 144 rough shabtis of pale blue glazed composition, 11 of which are overseer shabtis and 21 of which might have a different model (shape and size vary). The glaze has mostly disappeared except on one example.
